#Text=Plant an Avocado Pit
#Text=Avocado is one of the beautiful fruits typically grown in summer .
#Text=High in both flavor and vitamins , this fruit is also surprisingly easy to grow and nurture .
#Text=It makes a simple , satisfying project for people of all ages .
#Text=Though avocados may take a long time to bear fruit , something about homegrown avocados make it worth the wait !
#Text=Read this article to learn how to grow an avocado ; from pit to fruit .
#Text=This fruit is delicious but also healthy with lots of vitamins .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Take an avocado and cut it in half .
#Text=Be careful not to damage the pit ( also known as an avocado seed ) .
#Text=Use a knife and make a small cut in the avocado skin .
#Text=Twist both sides of the fruit to release the seed .
#Text=Use a knife as needed to take out the pit .
#Text=Rinse the avocado pit ; make sure you do n't damage it .
#Text=The seed is the most crucial part of the process !
#Text=Stick the 3 toothpicks in the avocado : careful not to poke it in the line in the center of the pit .
#Text=Stick it in at approximately a 45-degree angle .
#Text=Take a plastic cup and fill it up with water .
#Text=Place the avocado pit in the water .
#Text=Soak at least half of the avocado pit .
#Text=Next just put it in a warm , sunny spot ( out of direct sunlight ) on a windowsill , and let it sit there .
#Text=Be patient ; avocados take a long time to grow .
#Text=Change the water on a daily basis .
#Text=Remove it out of the old water and switch it out with new water .
#Text=Make sure to wipe the avocado pit down ; as the old water can cause the seed to rot over time .
#Text=Allow the seed to sit in the cup when your seed starts sprouting and growing roots .
#Text=Once the leaves start yellowing and curling up , it is a sign that it needs to be put in the soil .
#Text=When you plant the avocado pit in soil , do n't put in the whole seed .
#Text=The avocado will not grow completely if done so .
#Text=Put half of the seed under soil and half of the seed above the dirt .
#Text=Make sure to water the avocado regularly ; avocados require a lot of water to bear fruit .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If possible , plant the avocado near fully grown trees ; this will aid with pollination .
#Text=You can also leave the seed outside for a week before you soak it in water .
#Text=That makes it easier to peel the skin off .
#Text=Plant the seed outside in an undisturbed spot .
#Text=Make sure it has lots of sunlight .
#Text=When your avocado tree gets larger , you may consider trimming it .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=The avocado needs time to grow .
#Text=It will not sprout as fast as you think it will .
